root: ^You graduated! Congratulations! That's a great accomplishment.
^Er, well… I didn't finish, I just kind of stopped going.
^Yeah, well, it happens. School is expensive.
^I'm on my way to visit my youngest now, they've been enrolled in university for a year now.
^Everytime I go to see them they seem to need more and more money for books and food and who knows what else.
^I remember it being really expensive when I was in school so that makes sense.
^I had two jobs and everything and I could barely get by.
^The amount of money my kid is asking me for, they must be spending it on something else.
^No way this could be for books or lunches, they must be out partying.
^They definitely don't have time for me anymore.
^You know how many times I've taken the train to see them in the last year?
^Uh… I don't know, I'm guessing a lot.
^Eighty! Eighty times! And you know how many times they've come back to visit me…
^They come back only for the holidays and school breaks and even then they are barely around.
^But she would always come visit home and eventually she moved back in with us.
^Some kids are different, I know that I wanted to get out and have my own life in the city.
^And break your poor mother's heart like that!
^Pardon me for imposing, but a mother likes to be close to her children, I know as one.
^I just feel like my kid is drifting away from me.
^Even when I visit they barely talk to me, they don't seem excited to see me, it's like it's another chore.
^Maybe they do feel like it is?
^That's awful! Every child should be happy to see their mother.
^Well, I mean, if you aren't giving them the space to live their own life, it may feel like that to them.
^They don't need space, family is important, family needs to be close.
^They just haven't learned to miss me properly yet.
